И так...что же такое портал...портал-это игра-головоломка с босом вконце...
На самом деле игра довольна простая,с самого начала и до самого конца,а именно прохождение представляет собой прохождение комнат испытаний,то есть мы проходим испытания,которые становятся всё сложнее и сложнее,но в конце концов,когда мы всё это проходим,нас хотят уничтожить,но конечно же гг спасается и идёт уничтожать главный мозг,сама игра цепляеет своей механикой парталов и заставляет хоть немного,но подумать,из-за чего её рекомендую всем
Много деталий раскрывать не буду,лучше самому в это поиграть,игра-шедевр,минусом можно назвать короткий сюжет,но это можит исправить 2-ая часть^_^

Well I can see why everyone likes this game so much. 

PLOT:

There ain't much of a plot, get Portal 2 for that, but it basically boils down to 'you're stuck in some labs, there's an AI who lies to you and will stop at nothing to kill you and you have to use your little gun to complete chambers and then escape' written like that, this game sounds rubbish.

GAMEPLAY

If you like a good story, try Portal 2. If you're more focused on puzzles, play both Portal and Portal 2 (and get the Portal Level Pack in LEGO Dimensions, like I did) because in this game you'll be taking on lots of puzzles. There are 19 test chambers, an escape sequence and a finale to play through, and you have to rely on the Portal Gun, a machine that can create gateways, to get from entrance to exit. I came into the game thinking 'Oh I'll just fire a portal by the entrance, fire one at the exit and then be off' but that's when you find out about the gun's one weakness - black walls. You'll also be using plenty of cubes to activate buttons and deflect lasers, and you'll encounter the GODAWFUL TURRETS!

THE TURRETS ARE ONE OF THE MOST ANNOYING THINGS I'VE MET IN ANY GAME! THEIR STUPID HIGH PITCHED VOICES! I EVEN HAD TO GET MY FRIEND TO COMPLETE THE FIRST TURRET CHAMBER! 

I just smashed up the turret I got in the LEGO Dimensions Portal pack. That feels much better,

The game has 98% positive reviews, what the hell are you still doing here?

[h1] 시작은 미약했으나 끝은 창대하리라	[/h1]
평범한 학생들이 만들었던 게임이 이렇게 될 줄 누가 알았을까요.
밸브 소프트웨어의 2007년 작, 포탈입니다.
2007년은 분명 FPS의 절정기라고 불릴 정도로 많은 명작 FPS 게임이 나왔습니다
전설로 남은 콜 오브 듀티: 모던 워페어부터 바이오쇼크, 크라이시스, 헤일로 3 등 수많은 명작 게임들이 나왔는데
자랑스럽게 그 대열에 포함할 수 있는 끼워팔기 게임인 포탈입니다.
이 많은 FPS와 포탈의 다른 점은 딱 하나, 게임성이라는 겁니다.
포탈에선 전투라는 개념이 없습니다. 플레이어가 포탈을 이용해서 퍼즐을 풀어나가는 게임이죠.
단순히 포탈을 이용한 공간 이동에서, 위치에너지의 보존을 이용한 점프까지 플레이어는 여러가지 퍼즐에 직면하게 되고
그것을 포탈건을 이용해서 풀아가야 합니다. 여기까지만 보면 평범한 퍼즐 게임이겠지만,
포탈은 달랐습니다. 스토리 라인에서 일어나는 반전 요소와 보스와의 최종전 등,
포탈은 스토리와 게임성 그리고 흥행성까지 잡은 명작이 되었습니다.

아까 말씀드렸다 시피 포탈은 현실의 물리 법칙을 적용하고 있는 요소가 있습니다.
거기에다 퍼즐 게임이니 선생님들이 아이 좋아라 하시면서 게임을 개량해 학생들에게 플레이하시도록 했죠.
여러분의 부모님이 게임을 하시는걸 극렬히 반대하신다면 포탈이라는 예시를 보여줍시다.

하지만 포탈은 분량이 정말 짧습니다. 끼워팔기용 게임이여서 그랬을까요
저는 퍼즐 게임을 잘 못하고 다 하는데도 오래 걸립니다. 그런 제가 7시간만에 게임을 끝내다니요.
분량이나 스토리 문제는 후속작인 포탈 2가 있으니까 걱정을 안하셔도 됩니다만,
3D 멀미는 진짜 심합니다. 소스 엔진을 사용한 게임에서 이런 현상이 두드러지긴 합니다만 포탈은 타 게임에 비해 좀 더 심합니다.
만약 여러분이 방방 뛰어다니면서 시점이 내 의지와 상관없이 돌아가는 것을 원치 않으신다면, 이 게임을 하기는 쉽지 않을 지도 모릅니다.
그리고 한 가지 더, 보너스 맵이 보너스 같지가 않습니다. 더럽게 어렵습니다.
제가 포탈을 한번 클리어한 시간보다 보너스맵 12개 깨는데 시간이 더 걸렸습니다.
이거 진짜 만든 사람 좀 불러주세요

그래도 스토리는 잘 만들었다고 몇번이나 강조해도 됩니다.
스토리를 다 깨시면 마지막엔 글라도스가 선물을 하나 주는데요, 맛있는 케이크입니다.
그런 의미에서 오늘은 맛있는 케이크로 가족과 신나는 저녁을 즐겨보세요

몇가지 아쉬운 점이 있지만 잘 만든 게임임은 분명합니다.
게임도 딱히 무섭지도 않고 실험실은 오히려 화이트 컬러 기반이라 거의 깔끔합니다. 
그래서 대부분의 분들에게 이 게임을 추천 드립니다.

buy portal 2
Best Game Ever

Truly, this is a future classic of our time. While I can't say anything that hasn't been said before, Portal is truly in a league of its own in the puzzle genre. The amount of attention to detail put into the environments and the level of thinking required in succeeding its tests is beyond that of other games, forcing the player to consider physics and the different possibilities opened up by the ASHPD. While it's not overly difficult to beat the game, you have to re-imagine the three-dimensional world around you- you have to think with portals. The mysterious nature of Aperture Science Laboratories and the comedic, yet occasionally cryptic monlogue GLaDOS spouts at you enhances the experience while hinting at the game's hidden truths. The addition of the Aperture Science Sentry Turrets later on adds another level of strategy, yet gives the game some action with the threat of death. I often found myself carefully considering my plan for making it through the chamber unscathed, and learning how to outwit my utterly hilarious foes gives the player a feeling of accomplishment in its own right. It's not very often that a game is so immersive, as well. the graphics are downright beautiful, the character and plot well-developed, and the mechanics perfected beyond perfection. The end sequence and end boss fight are wonderfully memorable, giving even more insight on what GLaDOS is and her motivations for her actions. I have only one qualm with this game, being that, while its writing is witty, its gameplay is captivating, and its mechanics are imaginative, it just doesn't last as long as you'd want it to. Portal is a sweet, yet somewhat short experience. That one flaw, I believe, is not nearly enough to impact this game's overall quality. 

Valve's Portal is an amazing achievement in game design, and it's worthy of my positive review.

But if you do like puzzles, you should play this game if you havent already. The learning curve is perfect, the puzzles are clever, and the story is minal but uninstruvise, only adding flavor to the expeirence. This game is a modern classic, and for good reason. It's an expertly crafted game every gamer who enjoys puzzles - even just a little - should give a try.

Game: Portal
My Overall Rating: 9/10

After playing through all of Portal's story mode and completing the amusing challenges and advanced levels, I feel that I'm ready to talk about what I liked and disliked about this game.

First off, the gameplay is outstanding. The puzzle solving in this game is spectacular, and unlike anything i've seen in a game. Levels ranged from easy challenges that i was able to figure out almost insantly, to mind numbingly tough puzzles that took me more time then i'd like to admit.

The story in this game is minimalist in the best ways. The calming but creepy voice of GLADoS as she guides you ultimately to your death is chilling. Though the final fight is quite easy, the journey to reach GLADoS is an unforgettable one.

The one gripe I had with this game is how short it is. I was able to complete this game in just about 3 hours, and though the challenges added a few more hours, the length definitely took away from the experience.

Overall, this is a game that all PC owners should buy, and though it won't take you a very long time, you will enjoy every second of the experience.

9/10
This Game is Awesome i may get the second one!

Of course if you don't already know. This game is fantastically well done. It's a fun puzzle based story, in which you are the puzzle piece and the portals are your tools.

It's a bit short but makes up for it in quality. The only minor flaw is the load time (which to be fair is probably fast for the time it was released) but I am not someone who has a big issue with waiting to play an amazing game. 

This is a testament to how games should be developed - thoughtfully, carefully, creatively, and with joy. I gotta commend Valve for this gem, they seem to understand how to be responsible developers.

It's crazy how much you can do with a portal gun.

I would recommend this game. The story is short but exciting. Looking around the levels reveals some additional background story. The main story is only part of the game. The achievments and additional levels make you play at least another 3 - 6 hours, however the main story itself is already worth the purchase. (I think everybody should spend at least a couple of hours messing around with the portal gun!)

This game really makes you think out of the box, that's what you need to do if you want the cake!

From the first day I've played Portal, I've loved it. Its puzzles actually help me relax from my daily stresses and focus on thinking creatively to solve them. A level a day keeps the stress away, in my opinion. Although there are recurring patterns in the puzzles which the game asks you to memorize, the levels vary slightly and there's always a surprise in each one. I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys solving puzzles and doesn't mind thinking about possible ways to solve certain levels overnight.
Puzzle games will never be the same after this masterpiece.

Extrêmement élégant et bien foutu.
Pas de sang, pas de bourrinage, un jeu super agréable, et à ne surtout pas manquer.

Le doy un 10/10. Esa sensacion de soledad, GLaDOS y en general la atmosfera es genial. 100% recomendable.
Игра хорошая, из-за нее мне захотелось купить Гаррис Мод!

This feels kinda of laglaster but I did get the portal bundle for $5 so shut my mouth I guess. This game has a bit history to it since it was made as a sorry gift for the late arrival of Half Life 2, a game I yet to play and will be playing soon as I get Half Life plus considering the fact that Yahtzee, The Hardest To Please Person out there could not find a criticism for the game means it has to be pretty good. Well then, you are wrong since I'm probley even harder to please so let's start.

First thing on the agenda, Portal Placement. Its Fucking Annoying. If one of your portals is slightly angled, you will have to wreastle the camera to aim your gun to shoot a new portal before you go through it again. This gets really annoying when you needed to portal somewhere while in infinte freefall as it is in Chamber 18 I think. Second thing, the fanbase... Lol, not really, its the puzzles. I know its a puzzle game and its appose to be hard but chamber 18 and later on chambers are just stupid. You need everything timed to the tee and if you fucked up once, you will have to wait and prepare everything again so yeah.

The game is nice to look at and if you need something to play between downloads, I would try this since Portal 2 at $20 isnt worth it so this the alt to the gaming's CLT-ALT-DEL with CLT being Half Life And DEL being Deus Ex.
Tenho q escrever uma análise entao, pra quem nao jogou esse jogo... no words for u

Starts off light and fluffy but get's twisted quickly. I laughed out loud with glee and delight at dropping through a portal and being thrown across the room by the force of the momentum. Fantastic experience! I'll get to Portal 2 once I've had a little break :)
처음 받아서 가장 행복했던 게임 할인할떄사면 진짜 이득인게임

Forgot how much I enjoyed this game. Really makes you look at things differently in order to work things out, but as the game plays on you get quicker at working things out. Never ruins the fun, though. Every chamber is always a challenge of some sort.
Absolutely amazing one of the reasons why i shared my library with my friend.

Just completed the game. It starts off easy but gets more difficult along the way. Not to the extend that you would find yourself sobbing in a corner or smashing your keyboard because you can't find the solution. Well... if you don't take the bonus map challenges into account that is. These challenges are ridiculously difficult in comparison to the game. I like a challenge, but some time-challenges took the fun out of the game for me. It's only then you notice handling objects isn't as smooth as you might hope and it can be a little frustrating. But enough about the challenges! I enjoyed playing the game. It's funny in it's own way and the level design is simple but nice.

PRO:
- Humor
- Fun level design
- Fairly solid gameplay
- Setting

CON:
- Not really bug-free
- Rather short
- Handling objects

The humor makes up for every CON I wrote down in my opinion. I can't remember how many times I had to chuckle while playing the game.

TL;DR:
Great game, ignore the bonus map challenges
I really like this game. Its really fun.
